column4: Is there a way to include your root password in the line you type 'sudo' so it doesnt prompt you for a pw?
if you wish you can do multiple commands as root by executing «sudo su»

Not sure what that means? I'm trying to get a command to run at a scheduled time. But the command I'm using sudo apt-get update --yes && apt-get upgrade --yes requires a password prompt to continue (which I wont be around for)
you can become root with sudo su and then set cron appropriately
